decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (1070(00)00; 1070(00)02 (existing ground floor plan); 1070(00)03 (existing first floor plan); 1070(00)03 (existing second floor plan); 1070(00)04 (existing roof plan); 1070(00)05 (existing front elevation); 1070(00)06 (existing rear elevation); 1070(00)07 (existing side elevation); 1070(00)08 (existing section A-A); 1070(00)10 (OS map); 11070(01)00 (proposed site plan); 1070(01)01 (proposed basement plan); 1070(01)02 (proposed ground floor plan); 1070(01)03 (proposed first floor plan); 1070(01)04 (proposed second floor plan); 070(01)05 (proposed roof plan); 1070(01)06 (proposed front elevation); 1070(01)07 (proposed rear elevation); 1070(01)08 (proposed side elevation); 1070(01)09 (proposed section A-A); Construction Method Statement; Planning Document; Flood Risk Assessment; Received 28/04/2016.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - The side window hereby approved shall be finished in obscure glazing and fixed shut below a level of 1.7 metres above internal finished floor level before the development hereby approved is first occupied. These arrangements shall be permanently retained.
Condition : 5 - The basement shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 6 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.

Condition : 7 - No excavation or construction work shall be undertaken prior to the submission and approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of a Construction Method Statement, which is certified by a qualified professional, giving specific details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area.

Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension and formation of basement with lightwells to the rear
